intro: Centaurea affinis subsp. peloponesiaca, commonly known as the Peloponnesian knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Greece. It is a herbaceous perennial with bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is characterized by its upright growth habit. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. This subspecies is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
